result.execSummary:
The defendant Artavis Lamarr Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).
  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time work, school or combination of the two. Complete high school or obtain a GED/HSED.

To commit no further law violations during the period of this agreement. No contact with the victim. To consume no alcoholic beverages or controlled substances. No entry into bars or taverns. Not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not drive any m/v unless or until his license has been reinstated.

Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office.  Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted.  This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment. Defendant shall comply with any and all rules of probation and successfully complete all conditions and any term of probation ordered as a part of this case.

Pay restitution in the amount of $9,618 plus DA surcharge of $1,923 for a total of $11,541.  The $3,000 cash bond shall be applied to restitition. Defendant agrees to pay a minimum of $300 per month beginning 3/01/16 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full. All payments shall be made to the DA's office, in the form of cash or money order, on behalf of the victim. All restitution owed to victim and DA surcharge must be paid in full by 12/01/18. Defendant understands that any late or missed payments shall be sufficient grounds to terminate the agreement and defnedant's plea to the felony charge would then be accepted and he would be sentenced on the felony count.

To pay all costs of the action. ($243)  Costs shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts officer on or before 1/01/19. Defendant shall contact the COC's office immediately to determine the total amount owed.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No contact with the victim.   Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. Restitution is to be paid to the victim FIRST (through DA's office) as part of the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement. Restitution is to be paid to Auto-Owners Insurance SECOND (through Dept. of Corrections).

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with the victim. Not to enter and bars or taverns.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Sentence can be served in any county that will accept him. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a different county. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order/Judgment for unpaid restitution/court ordered financial obligations
Order/Judgment for unpaid restitution/court ordered financial obligations
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
DOC request for civil judgment for unpaid restitution/court ordered financial obligations for Cts. 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6.

02:59 PM   Defendant Artavis Lamarr Wright in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Ann Nehring appears by phone.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  State indicates that victim TC has been paid restitution, still owes a large amount to Auto Owners.  Agent Nehring indicates defendant is on a wage assignment, feels defendant is paying what he can toward restitution. Agent Nehring uncertain if defendant will be extended or not, even if he's extended for 3 years, he's going to owe a large amount of money at the end of those 3 years.  Agent Nehring glad court scheduled hearing as DOC uncertain what they are doing with defendant yet, would like the court's opinion on how to proceed.  State has no objection to defendant discharging with civil judgment being entered for unpaid financial obligations. Court makes statement, has no objection to defendant discharging from probation in January with civil judgment being entered for remaining balance due on restitution and other financial obligations owing. Court encourages defendant to set up payment plan with Clerk of Courts and Auto Owners once he's discharged from probation.
Probation review hearing on November 29, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Artavis Lamarr Wright in court with attorney Clarence F. Duchac.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to revoke DAGPA. Defense not contesting revoation of DAGPA. Court finds defendant is freely, knowingly and voluntarily not contesting revocation of the DAGPA. Court accepts no contest plea on Ct. 1, finds defendant guilty.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.
Motion hearing on April 11, 2018 at 11:30 am.
to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

to signature bond
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Artavis Lamarr Wright in court with attorney Clarence F. Duchac.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State files amended Information, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 2 - 6. Court withholds accepting of the plea on Ct. 1 to allow defendant the opportunity to complete terms of the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement. Court reviews DAGPA with defendant, advises of collateral consequences if he should be convicted of the felony. Court approves agreement. State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Duchac gives sentencing argument. Defendant apologizes to the victim for his actions. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond remains in effect regarding Ct. 1.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for February 4, 2019 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Artavis Lamarr Wright in court with attorney Clarence F. Duchac.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Duchac advises matter is not resolved, asks court to set matter for trial. State was contemplating filing a motion to combine traffic file and felony file together for trial. Atty Duchac asks that felony file be set for trial first, doesn't want to confuse the jury. Court will set 15-CF-39 for pretrial and jury trial, 15-CT-29 will track along. Counsel recommend court set trial for 3 days. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Artavis Lamarr Wright in court with attorney Clarence F. Duchac.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
